Name_2: Saragarhi Day 2021 commemorated with 3m bronze statue of Sikh soldier
Text_2:
A three-metre high bronze statue of a heroic Sikh soldier has been unveiled in Wolverhampton to mark Saragarhi Day 2021.

The annual Saragarhi Day commemorates the men who died defending a modern-day Pakistan on 12 September 1897.

Saragarhi was a small outpost on the border between British India and Afghanistan in the north-west frontier.

When 21 men of the 36th Sikhs found themselves surrounded by 10000 hostile Afghan fighters they had a choice: surrender or fight to the last round of ammunition.

They chose the latter and all 21 men died.

The statue was unveiled close to the Guru Nanak Gurdwara in Wednesfield and depicts Havildar Ishar Singh the officer in charge of the Sikh soldiers who fought to the very end.

The organisers of the Wolverhampton event the Guru Nanak Gurdwara asked the British Army for support.
Name_3: Curtis Jones move urged as Liverpool £3m transfer told to stay 'under the radar'
Text_3:
Jurgen Klopp has been urged to play Curtis Jones in a more advanced role to help unlock the undoubted potential of the Liverpool youngster.

Jones has yet to feature this season having been ruled out of the opening game at Norwich City through concussion protocols while not even making the bench against Chelsea last time out.

The 20-year-old also suffered frustration when the postponement of England under-21's game against Romania meant he had to serve a one-match ban against Kosovo instead and failed to play during the international break.

Jones is likely to finally be given minutes over the next few weeks as Liverpool begin a busy spell of seven games in 22 days with Sunday's Premier League trip to Leeds United.

READ MORE:'There is no need' - Jurgen Klopp adamant over Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold

And former Liverpool winger Steve McManaman believes a shift in position could help the Academy graduate follow the path of Trent Alexander-Arnold.

"Curtis needs to kick on again just like every player" said McManaman who now works for BT Sport.

"Trent hasn't stopped - his trajectory has just kept on going from a 16 17-year-old who was playing U18 and U23 level and then up to the first team.

"Curtis has been exactly the same. U18s he was a superstar. U23s he was leading goalscorer and the best player and had to move up to the first team as he was too good for the U23s.

"He just needs to keep on doing that keep on improving and keep on adding to his game.

"Maybe he needs to play a little bit further forward and I'd prefer to see that. He takes people on really easily and I want to see more of that.

Sign up for daily Liverpool news Get all the latest Liverpool breaking news team news transfer rumours injury updates plus analysis of what's next for the Reds. You'll also get the latest transfer talk and analysis every day for FREE! Sign up here - it only takes a few seconds!

"But he has to keep on improving because he's playing with Mo Salah and Sadio Mane and Jordan Henderson and Fabinho and Thiago players of that standard. But is he good enough? Absolutely."

McManaman is a regular visitor to Liverpool's Academy in Kirkby and has seen much of the U18 and U23 teams in recent seasons.

And the ex-Red has been particularly impressed with the 16-year-old Kaide Gordon following his £3million move from Derby County in February.

"I spoke to Kaide after the Chelsea game" said McManaman. "He has had a really good summer and has really impressed the manager.

"Because of the Euros and Copa America there were a lot of kids in Jurgen's group in pre-season and I know he was impressed by a lot of them.

"Kaide is a really good kid excellent footballer and a real talent.

"He is doing everything right and because he's only a young kid you want to keep him under the radar.

Join the Blood Red Club to unlock EXCLUSIVE podcasts and videos Want more of our Blood Red podcasts? Then join the Blood Red Club to receive exclusive content direct to your inbox every week - and it won't cost you a penny. Sign up here - it only takes a few seconds

"But he's not the only one. Layton Stewart was doing well before his ACL injury the team got to the Youth Cup final and lost to a decent Aston Villa side who had 5000 of their own fans in and Liverpool were missing some players.

"The Academy is really strong at the moment. It has nurtured a lot of talent and you just hope that the likes of Layton and Tom Hill who has also had an ACL injury get back to where they were earlier as they were on a really good path.

"The fact the U18s and U23s have started the season well shows the Academy are doing an incredible job."

Name_4: New £3m Home Bargains proves hit with shoppers on opening day
Text_4:
Something went wrong please try again later.

Invalid email Something went wrong please try again later.

Want Stoke-on-Trent news emailed to you direct from our journalists? Sign up to our newsletter

Something went wrong please try again later.

Want Stoke-on-Trent news emailed to you direct from our journalists? Sign up to our newsletter

Scores of shoppers descended on Home Bargains' newest store today after months of waiting for the grand launch.

The doors were opened to the £3 million Festival Park branch at 8am this morning as some shoppers lined up outside while others waited in their cars.

And those looking to snap up a few bargains - including the much sought-after Halloween pumpkin jars - have been impressed with the sprawling new store along with its bakery.

More Festival Park news

Manager Neil Birks who has worked for Home Bargains for 15 years said: "It has been a long time coming but we are now finally open.

"I am glad we have it open and have had people through the doors.

"We have no special offers on. Our prices are always low and the low prices are here to stay.

"We have a bakery and we have all had training for it."

The 32-year-old added: "The staff are helpful. We want to send everybody out with a smile on their face. Customer service is number one for us. We want to make sure everybody has a good experience when they come and that they get what they want and more."

The 15920 sq ft store is stocked with homeware health and beauty products and fresh and frozen food. There is even a bakery providing fresh bread pastries and cakes - which will all be baked in-store daily.

A total of 58 people are employed at the store - with 51 of those new recruits.

Stoke-on-Trent Central MP Jo Gideon was among those paying a visit this morning. She said: "It's great to see Home Bargains come to Festival Park creating over 50 new jobs for local people.

"I had a walk round this morning and it was great to see how popular it is. I wish them all the best."

Plenty of shoppers had turned out to land a Halloween pumpkin jar. Among those was Audrey Gardiner of Congleton who was first in the queue. The 43-year-old said: "I am here because it is a new opening and there is a Halloween jar which everybody is trying to get. I have been to 10 stores and can't get them but this store has them."

Chloe Heath of Wolstanton had also headed along to get a pumpkin jar. The 36-year-old said: "It is really good. I came for the pumpkin jars and managed to get two. I know there are lots of Home Bargains but it is nice to have one here. It is nice and open and there are parent and child parking areas. I can't fault it. It's really good."

Shopper Natalie Potter aged 32 of Abbey Hulton said: "We were up at 6am and got here early and waited in the car park.

"I have watched this Home Bargains being built brick by brick.

"I am here for the Christmas stuff."

Sue Robinson aged 50 of Norton was impressed by the fresh products. She said: "The bakery is good. It has some nice fresh bread. I have just been to Morrisons and thought I would just pop in. Our closest Home Bargains is in Tunstall. This is a lot easier."

More stories

Shoppers demand action over beggars blighting Festival Park

Landlord says sorry as mum and sick son 3 left without hot water for five days

Royal Stoke moves back to highest alert level as Covid cases rise

Maintenance worker 48 found dead by wife at North Staffordshire home

Anger as elderly cyclist left on roadside for 172 minutes waiting for ambulance

David Smyth aged 59 of Nantwich visited the store with 14-year-old daughter Francesca.

He bought a soup maker and Francesca bought a rock lamp and a few other bits and bobs.

David said: "It is really good. We were impressed with the store."

Steve Hayes aged 57 of Century Street Hanley visited the store with his 33-year-old wife Chaz.

Steve said: "We always went to the one in Burslem. We have always found them cheap.

"There is a lot more choice here than Burslem. We will be doing our weekly shopping here. The staff are lovely. It is nice to see more people on the tills. We hope it stays that way."

The site had previously played host to PC World and Furniture Outlet. Permission to transform it into a Home Bargains was given by Stoke-on-Trent City Council in October 2019.

The store is open from 8am to 8pm Monday to Saturday and 10am to 4pm on Sunday.

Name_5: Sir Tom Finney Community High School to see new car park and other changes
Text_5:
Sir Tom Finney Community High School. Pic: Google

A planning application has been submitted for works to be done to Sir Tom Finney Community High School.

The changes include a new car park lighting columns 3m tall security fencing and re-formed mound.

The current use of the site proposed is a grassed area within the school in Ribbleton.

Read more: Plans submitted for Whittingham and Goosnargh Sports And Social Club expansion

There are currently has 69 standard car parking spaces and seven disabled spaces at the school and another 30 will be added including three disabled spaces.

As well as this an existing grass mound will be partially re-formed as it impedes the eastern side of the proposed car park.

The existing 3m tall security fence running through the middle of the car parks location will be moved to the western boundary of the car park as well as being extended.

Read more: Complaints about listed marker stone painted outside Harris Park

Also to comply with current regulations the new car park is to be illuminated via 8x 6m tall lighting columns.

The car park is to be formed with a tarmac finish and concrete kerbs to match the existing and white lining to set out car parking spaces and direction of travel arrows.

Name: Abbott
Name_1: Gov. Abbott Issues Proclamation Marking 20th Anniversary Of 9/11
Text_1:
AUSTN (CBSDFW.COM) — Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued a proclamation to mark the 20th anniversary of the 9/11 terror attacks Saturday.

In the proclamation the governor urges all Texans to take a moment to remember the lives lost on Sept. 11 2001.

"Today marks twenty years since that Tuesday morning when the United States came face-to-face with tragedy and destruction in the wake of terrorist attacks in New York City Washington D.C. and Pennsylvania.

Over the course of a single morning we lost family members friends loved ones coworkers — each one with hopes and dreams. Twenty years later we still feel their loss... As we united in the face of destruction and tragedy let us once again remember the enduring patriotism that binds us together as one nation. Together we will be a guiding light for generations to come."
Name_2: Fundraiser for Destry Abbott's Wife
Text_2:
Cycle News Staff | September 11 2021

Enter raffle for a change to win a 2019 KTM 150SX

Road2Recovery is assisting Destry Abbott with a raffle to raise funds for Charlotte Destry’s wife who has cancer. The motorcycle up for grabs is a fully loaded 2019 KTM 150SX. Here is the letter from Destry Abbott and more about his family’s circumstance:

Hi Everyone

I wanted to give you an update regarding how my wife Charlotte is doing and also ask for a favor. As most of you know Charlotte’s breast cancer has returned and this time has spread to her bones. In addition she broke her back due to brittle bones not long after her diagnoses. It’s now been 5-months since her accident and a little less than that since starting her chemo treatments. She’s currently doing a lot better with her back and has relearned to walk and can now take care of herself which is awesome! She finished her main chemo treatment but the cancer hasn’t fully disappeared so they’re keeping her on a three week maintenance cycle to see if that helps. Unfortunately she wasn’t able to complete her last treatment due to results from her last echocardiogram so now she’s having to see a cardiologist to make sure her heart is able to handle the treatment before we move forward.

The good news is we have her scheduled to go to MD Anderson in Houston Texas at the end of October for a second opinion and she’s staying positive and working towards rebuilding her strength. This is where I went for my treatments and we feel it’s the best place to go in the world! They have a lot of trials and advanced medicine that can possibly help her out. Of course we’ve also had an amazing support system and we are so overwhelmed and thankful to everyone that has stepped up in so many ways to help. Our kids and family have gone above and beyond to help take care of her during this time. We’ve had amazing close friends such as Cody Miller (from CM Offroad) who surprised us by donating and building up a KTM 150 from the ground up with help from the sponsors listed below specifically for the purpose of raffling it off to help raise funds for the battle we have in front of us. Road2Recovery is taking care of the logistics for the raffle and helping make a push to the community for us.

Many of you are aware of the non-profit DA8 Strong Foundation (501c3) that we started after Charlotte and I recovered from our treatments back in 2017 focused on helping cancer patients. This is a passionate cause for us obviously and we really put a lot of work into helping cancer patients with this foundation. Ironically the only cancer patients we can’t help with this foundation is ourselves since we are the founders and on the board of the foundation.

So our ask of you is if you would be able to share the info regarding this raffle to help raise money for bills and traveling expenses that would mean so much to our family! We’re not the type of people to ask for anything but we have some tough times ahead and could really use the help.

The bike will also be on display at the final AMA National Motocross in Hangtown this weekend at the Road2Recovery tent. Huge thank you to them for stepping up and taking care of all of this for us! <3

Name: Accenture
Name_1: Australian government commences work on digital vaccine passport for international travel
Text_1:
Image: Getty Images

A new Australian digital vaccine passport is officially in the works with the Australian government announcing it has selected Accenture to build the technology.

The digital vaccine passport called the Digital Passenger Declaration (DPD) will replace physical incoming passenger cards and the COVID-19 Australian Travel Declaration web forms the government said.

Functionally it will link with the QR code vaccination certificate that is set to be introduced later this month and capture essential information up to 72 hours prior to a person boarding a plane.

Australians currently use either a digital or paper certificate to indicate their COVID-19 vaccination status which can be retrieved through the Express Plus Medicare mobile app or a myGov account. These certificates are filled with various issues however with users easily able to forge their records.

"The DPD will support the safe re-opening of Australia's international borders by providing digitally-verified COVID-19 vaccination details" Minister of Home Affairs Karen Andrews said.

"This will help us to welcome home increasing numbers of Australians and welcome the tourists travellers international students skilled workers and overseas friends and family we've all been missing during the pandemic."

See also: How Australia's tech-savvy COVID-19 response is leaving CALD communities behind

Accenture was selected to build the DPD following a competitive tender process that was run by Home Affairs.

The company will work alongside Home Affairs to deliver the initial operating capability of the DPD later in the year.

The DPD will first undergo testing before it is deployed at major Australian airports.

In terms of when the DPD will be rolled out the federal government has not given a definite timeline.

Once the DPD is rolled out the government will also consider other use cases for the technology that the DPD is based on said Stuart Robert the Minister responsible for data and digital policy.

The digitisation program could potentially be used for visas import permits personnel identity cards licenses registrations and other documents he said.

The announcement of the new digital system follows the federal government last year shelving its plan to privatise Australia's visa processing system terminating the contentious request-for-tender process for its proposed Global Digital Platform.

At the same time government-owned Healthdirect Australia has launched a new portal for finding and booking vaccination appointments.

Both federal and state governments already have their own respective booking portals but these portals do not display appointments for vaccine clinics that are listed as "phone only" bookings.

The new vaccine clinic finder is meant to show vaccine appointments across every clinic registered with the National COVID-19 Vaccine Taskforce Healthdirect Australia CEO Bettina McMachon said.

"This system is the only one which shows vaccine appointments across every clinic registered with the National COVID-19 Vaccine Taskforce -- whether they be general practice pharmacy or State/Territory vaccination centres. Offered in multiple languages it provides the most choice for consumers to find a time and place that suits them to get a vaccine" she said.

Name: Adobe
Name_1: The Faster and More Accurate Way to Zoom in Adobe Premiere Pro
Text_1:
Whether you're a videographer or not you'll likely find yourself having to use a video editor at one point or another. If you think that is or will be true for you here is an incredible tip for one of the key functions in Adobe Premiere Pro.

Whenever somebody tells me a tip is going to blow my mind I am usually left thoroughly unmoved. This video however is not an example of that. I have been using Adobe Premiere Pro and Sony Vegas for many years at this point and zooming in and out of videos is irritating. I have to find the right keyframe to start the transition either manually navigate the zoom over several keyframes or allow it to move itself between two and it's all time-consuming. It is one of those jobs like making complex selections in Photoshop: it's dull and longwinded but there aren't any great workarounds out there.

In this video PiXimperfect tries out an extension for Premiere Pro called Drag Zoom Pro and it allows you to make smooth transitions in the easiest quickest and the most intuitive way I have seen yet. I'm not sure if this video by PiXimperfect is sponsored by the creator of Drag Zoom Pro and frankly I don't care if it is! If you use Adobe Premiere Pro for anything — videography creating photography tutorials behind-the-scenes footage whatever it may be — this plugin looks to be an incredible quality of life improvement.
Name_2: Who is Prativa Mohapatra the new chief of Adobe India?
Text_2:
Elevate Your Tech Prowess with High-Value Skill Courses Offering College Course Website Indian School of Business ISB Product Management Visit Indian School of Business Professional Certificate in Product Management Visit MIT MIT Technology Leadership and Innovation Visit

Nivruti Rai country head Intel India

Susan Wojcicki CEO of YouTube

Whitney Wolfe Herd CEO of Bumble

Roshni Nadar chairperson of HCL Technologies

Lisa Su CEO of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)

Safra A. Catz CEO of Oracle Corp.

Adobe Inc. recently appointed Prativa Mohapatra as vice president and managing director for Adobe India . With this Mohapatra becomes the first woman to lead the global software maker’s operations in the country.So who is Prativa Mohapatra With 25 years of experience Mohapatra started her career at PwC India . Mohapatra joins Adobe from IBM where she was the vice president of digital sales for Asia-Pacific. Before this she led the sales department of IBM India and South Asia. She is known for building teams to achieve hyper-growth and leading business transformations. She is also involved in mentoring women on their leadership journey.Mohapatra pursued her B.Tech in computer sciences and engineering from Regional Engineering College (now NIT) Rourkela followed by her post-graduation in management at Xavier Institute of Management Bhubaneswar where she specialized in Systems and Finance.At Adobe she will oversee the San Jose-based company's India business and growth opportunity across three units: Adobe Experience Cloud Adobe Creative Cloud and Adobe Document Cloud. She will be reporting to Adobe’s President for Asia Pacific (APAC) Simon Tate.“Adobe is uniquely positioned as an enabler for everyone—students creative artists small businesses government agencies and the largest brands—to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences" Mohapatra said in the company statement that announced her appointment. "I am thrilled to join the world-class team at Adobe India and propel our business vision in the country."Women also lead Adobe’s operations in South Korea (Mary Woo) and Australia (Suzanne Steele).
Name_3: Plaza Hotel in San Juan Bautista undergoes restoration
Text_3:
Restoration work at the Plaza Hotel. Photo by Robert Eliason. Damage to the adobe. Photo by Robert Eliason. Restoration work at the Plaza Hotel. Photo by Robert Eliason. Damage to the adobe. Photo by Robert Eliason. Two-story outhouse. Photo by Robert Eliason. Rich Winklebleck. Photo by Robert Eliason.

In the early days of San Juan Bautista the stage carrying well-to-do travelers would have stopped in front of either the National Hotel which stood on the site of Verutti Park on Second Street or the Plaza Hotel which still stands as the centerpiece of the San Juan Bautista State Historic Park.

Now after four years of planning and a $30000 state of California grant long-needed restoration work on the 208-year-old hotel is underway to preserve the building and its unique history for generations to come. It is the third restoration since the park was created in 1968 and follows a three-year project that ended in 1981.

“That was a major retrofitting along with a restoration” said the park’s lead interpreter Marcos Vizcaino. “They made new adobe bricks for the walls; they replastered repainted and then they redecorated.”

The current restoration which started in July and is scheduled to finish in November is less extensive.

“The exterior restoration on the Plaza Hotel includes fixing any of the damaged facade and the adobe framing fixing any of the windows and doors and then giving it a full paint job” said Rich Winklebleck park maintenance chief for the Gavilan Hills sector.

The restoration is complicated by the different construction methods used over the years as new owners adapted it to different uses.

“The building was built in two major stages” Vizcaino said. “The first floor was built out of adobe in 1813 as a barracks for the Spanish soldiers and it took about a year to complete with whitewashed walls dirt floors and a red tile roof. Six soldiers were stationed there. When Mexico took over the area the barracks were used for their soldiers.

In the 1830s another barrack was built and this building became a private residence for the Anzar family.

In 1853 Angelo Zanetta bought it and remodeled it into a destination hotel. The tile roof was removed and the second story of wood construction was placed on top of the existing adobe walls.

“He had noticed that thousands of people came to town during the yearly San Juan Fiesta on the feast day of John the Baptist” Vizcaino said. “He knew they needed a place to stay and he also wanted to have a makeshift saloon to sell liquor during the week-long celebration—and he made a lot of money doing that.”

Zanetta chose to open on the feast day June 24 1856. The hotel included a five-star restaurant. The bar was often patronized by the local Californios who remained on horseback inside while drinking or playing pool.

“There would be an alert when the stage was approaching the hotel” Vizcaino said “and it was the job of Zanetta’s young daughter to roust all of the horsemen out of the bar before new visitors arrived.”

According to Vizcaino upon arriving women and children were not allowed to stay on the ground floor and were escorted upstairs to a common drawing room. Men were taken to the bar to check in and drink or play cards. There was a special two-story outhouse built with the higher level accessed by a covered catwalk.

The roof on that outhouse and the adjoining icehouse are targets for repair as is the entire side of the building facing Mariposa Street which is currently covered in scaffolding. There are repairs required to other parts of the building to replace damaged wood eroded adobe and leaking roofs.

“There is nothing that is structurally endangered” Winklebleck said. “It is more to preserve the historical fabric of the building itself. There are some issues with the condition and some past repairs have dilapidated because they were done incorrectly. There is also water intrusion and weather damage.”

With a well-documented architectural history and the records of previous restorations available the work is thoroughly based on accuracy.

“We have plans for what the finished woodworking looked like so we have a good reference to that” Winklebleck said. “The most difficult things are matching colors and getting the adobe right. We have paint analysis on the earliest layer on a piece of the original molding. But things like the adobe require using accurate materials and methods to be historically sound.”

While other buildings in the park are in need of similar repair Winklebleck thinks the Plaza Hotel is a good place to start the work.

“This is where everything in the park is centered and where it all began” he said. “If we let this building dilapidate we lose the heart of the park. It is something people recognize from their childhood from coming to the park on their mission field trips. It is an important part of our history and it is critical we preserve it.”

Name_4: Converting "dirty money” into “clean money” enables human trafficking
Text_4:
Why does money-laundering matter? Isn’t it just a victimless crime?

Money-laundering is far from a victimless crime claims Gary Murray an anti-money laundering expert at Chartered Bank. “When there’s money-laundering going on invariably there are individuals who’ve suffered.”

Criminal activity always has a victim

What exactly is money-laundering? Basically it turns money that was obtained from criminal activity such as drug-dealing or sex-trafficking into money that appears to come from a legitimate source. Engaging in this activity is a crime.

As for why money-laundering is always predicated on someone’s suffering Murray explains that by definition criminal activity involves a victim. In the case of money-laundering some examples include:

People whose lives are destroyed by the illegal drugs that drug traffickers push.

The dead and wounded that result from the activities of illegal arms dealers.

The people condemned to live in slavery because of human traffickers.

For Murray a particularly noxious side of money-laundering is that “cleaning” dirty money helps enable human trafficking. Money-laundering is a central component of human trafficking.

Traffickers need to launder their money

If it weren’t for money-laundering human trafficking would not be the $150 billion a year industry it is today. “Criminals engage in human trafficking because it’s profitable” states Murray.

However he continues “traffickers can only benefit from the money they’ve made if they can make it appear that the money was obtained legally and they can have it enter the legitimate financial system.”

In other words they need to launder the money they obtained when they were enslaving another person and make it appear that the money was obtained legitimately.

Why can’t they just spend the cash?

Spending large amounts of cash is harder than it might seem. For a start large amounts of cash are a logistical nightmare.

As Murray says “Suppose you’re a trafficker and you have a million dollars in cash. Right there you have a problem. If you have it in one-dollar bills those bills will weigh 2200 pounds.” Even if you have the cash in $100 bills "you’re still up against lugging around 22 pounds of cash.”

Spending that much cash isn’t just problematic. Because of current anti-money laundering laws it’s close to impossible.

Suppose Mr. Trafficker wants to use his cash to buy the $100000 car he’s been wanting. If he puts down more than $10000 in cash the car dealer—or any other businessperson—is required to file an IRS Form 8300.

The form is entered into an IRS database and it’s electronically flagged. IRS and other law enforcement agencies are now interested in Mr. Trafficker.

He needs to avoid this.

Source: Stock Adobe

So how does he launder his dirty money so he can spend it without coming to the attention of law enforcement? How does he get to the point where he can spend the money on a car boat mansion or anything else?

Ways to launder money

His goal is to place the cash in a financial institution where he can transfer it electronically to any place he chooses. There are endless ways he could do it. Some of these include:

He can put the money in a suitcase or box and then drive sail or fly to another country one with more accommodating banking laws.

He can hire “money mules” to open dozens of small banking accounts designed to fly under the radar of the banking regulations.

He can open a business with large cash receipts such as a limousine service or a nail salon or an online auction house and hide the ill-gotten cash among the legal receipts.

He can buy high-value art for cash and then resell it showing a receipt for the legitimate sale of his art item.

These are just a few of the options open to him. Anti-money-laundering specialists like Murray spend their professional lives studying how the “laundrymen” do it and then figuring out how to thwart them.

Every time Murray and his colleagues can prevent any money-laundering the downstream benefits to society are enormous. In the case of human trafficking the more successful anti-money laundering efforts are the less reason traffickers have to engage in their hideous trade.

“We can’t stop all money-laundering” concedes Murray “but we can identify and prosecute as many of the criminals as we can. We are working to reduce as much suffering as we can.”

What keeps Murray going in this dark and daunting task? “I’m always looking forward to those times when I can say ‘Gotcha!’”

Name: Advanced Micro Devices
Name_1: Jennifer Lopez Stuns in Dolce & Gabbana Gown for Gondola Photo Shoot as She and Ben Affleck Depart Venice
Text_1:
09/11/2021 Jennifer Lopez is seen on a gondola in Venice Italy. The 52 year old took to the water for a stunning photoshoot wearing a Dolce & Gabbana strapless tulle ballgown.

TheImageDirect.com

Jennifer Lopez is the queen of Italy!

On Saturday the 52-year-old singer took part in a stunning photo shoot on a gondola in Venice during the last day of the 2021 Venice Film Festival.

She modeled a Dolce & Gabbana strapless tulle ball gown on the water. The elaborate dress featured a print of the Italian city and was accessorized with a thin black belt around the "Let's Get Loud" singer's waist.

Lopez wore glamorous makeup for the shoot as well with her cheekbones defined and her lips covered in a bold statement-making red lipstick.

RELATED: Jennifer Lopez Says She's 'Back on the Block' in Glam Photos as She and Ben Affleck Hit Venice

After the photo shoot she and Ben Affleck reportedly headed to the airport.

09/11/2021 Jennifer Lopez is seen on a gondola in Venice Italy. The 52 year old took to the water for a stunning photoshoot wearing a Dolce & Gabbana strapless tulle ballgown.

TheImageDirect.com

The night prior to her gondola moment Lopez and boyfriend Affleck set the red carpet ablaze at the Venice Film Festival.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

There Lopez and Affleck 49 made an entrance at the premiere of the actor's new film The Last Duel — their first red carpet appearance since rekindling their romance earlier this year.

Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez

Pascal Le Segretain/Getty Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez

Lopez brought out all the bling wearing a white mermaid-style Georges Hobeika gown with a deep neckline accentuated with a string of Swarovski crystal embellishments. She accessorized with a Cartier bracelet earrings and a ring featuring yellow jewels an embellished silver clutch and Jimmy Choo platforms.

Affleck meanwhile looked dapper in a black Dolce & Gabbana tuxedo with satin lapel and Christian Louboutin shoes. The couple held hands and kissed as the photographers snapped their pictures.

RELATED VIDEO: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck Make Their Red Carpet Return in Venice

Lopez (who previously was engaged to Alex Rodriguez) and Affleck (who had split from Ana de Armas) rekindled their romance in April before going Instagram official in July for the singer's birthday.

RELATED: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck Make Their Red Carpet Return in Venice: See Every Gorgeous Photo

Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck leaving Venice Italy - 11 Sep 2021

Ciao Pix/Shutterstock

The pair originally began dating in July 2002 after meeting on the set of their movie Gigli. They got engaged that November before postponing their September 2003 wedding just days before the original date and ultimately called off their engagement in January 2004.

Since the couple rekindled their romance they have continued to grow even closer. A source told PEOPLE in May that their relationship is different this time around. "Time has passed and they are each in a different place with children" the insider said.
Name_2: Who is Prativa Mohapatra the new chief of Adobe India?
Text_2:
Elevate Your Tech Prowess with High-Value Skill Courses Offering College Course Website Indian School of Business ISB Product Management Visit Indian School of Business Professional Certificate in Product Management Visit MIT MIT Technology Leadership and Innovation Visit

Nivruti Rai country head Intel India

Susan Wojcicki CEO of YouTube

Whitney Wolfe Herd CEO of Bumble

Roshni Nadar chairperson of HCL Technologies

Lisa Su CEO of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)

Safra A. Catz CEO of Oracle Corp.

Adobe Inc. recently appointed Prativa Mohapatra as vice president and managing director for Adobe India . With this Mohapatra becomes the first woman to lead the global software maker’s operations in the country.So who is Prativa Mohapatra With 25 years of experience Mohapatra started her career at PwC India . Mohapatra joins Adobe from IBM where she was the vice president of digital sales for Asia-Pacific. Before this she led the sales department of IBM India and South Asia. She is known for building teams to achieve hyper-growth and leading business transformations. She is also involved in mentoring women on their leadership journey.Mohapatra pursued her B.Tech in computer sciences and engineering from Regional Engineering College (now NIT) Rourkela followed by her post-graduation in management at Xavier Institute of Management Bhubaneswar where she specialized in Systems and Finance.At Adobe she will oversee the San Jose-based company's India business and growth opportunity across three units: Adobe Experience Cloud Adobe Creative Cloud and Adobe Document Cloud. She will be reporting to Adobe’s President for Asia Pacific (APAC) Simon Tate.“Adobe is uniquely positioned as an enabler for everyone—students creative artists small businesses government agencies and the largest brands—to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences" Mohapatra said in the company statement that announced her appointment. "I am thrilled to join the world-class team at Adobe India and propel our business vision in the country."Women also lead Adobe’s operations in South Korea (Mary Woo) and Australia (Suzanne Steele).

Name: Air Products and Chemicals
Name_1: Conformal coatings market to grow to $1.18B
Text_1:
The global conformal coatings market size is expected to reach USD 1.18 billion by 2028 according to a new study by Polaris Market Research. Conformal coatings are a protective cover that could be a polymer or a chemical film that is applied on electronic circuits to give them long-lasting protection from moisture content and chemical contaminants in the air. These products maintain insulation cover ensure continuity of circuit board components and oversee functional integrity of the circuit board.

A huge market for consumer electronics rapid strides in medical equipment and the emergence of driverless cars are some of the important factors driving the conformal coatings industry. Furthermore the rise in disposable incomes and dependence on sleek electronic devices such as mobile phones laptops and other gadgets have fueled the growth of particular products that are mandatorily used in electronic components.

Material to protect sensitive information on PCB

Automotive is one of the most far-reaching segments for these products. The development of hybrid cars is consistently empowered by technology and witnesses a comfortably high growth rate being touted as an energy-efficient alternative. Electric cars and hybrid vehicles could give a more comfortable ride optimum fuel efficiency and use more electronic gadgets giving rise to the sophistication that is the foundation of EV’s.

Advertisement

Initially these products were the mainstays in medical and military products but with high cost per unit. But with innovations and with rising of material science prices have reduced considerably over the last few years. Recent technological nuances in the market include low viscosity solvent-free conformal coating parylene-like hydrophobic conformal coating and single component conformal coating material to protect sensitive information on PCBs.

PCB assemblers favour conformal coatings for economic environmental reasons

These products are unique based on their material of formulation. These coatings are used bringing to the fore their characteristics and required efficiency. Acrylic conformal coating is the largest product segment by material. Polyurethane epoxy and parylene are amongst the fast-growing segments.

Most of the product manufacturers device fabricators and printed circuit board (pcb) assemblers favour conformal coatings for economic and environmental reasons though solvent-based ones prop up performance. A move towards green chemicals has certain resins moving at a faster rate as compared to traditional ones such as acrylics.

The report gives a detailed insight into the current market dynamics and provides analysis on future market growth. For more info visit: https://www.polarismarketresearch.com/industry-analysis/conformal-coatings-market/request-for-sample

Name: Airbnb
Name_1: Millennials help Malaysia get ready for travel recovery with Airbnb
Text_1:
Over 60% of new Airbnb Hosts in H1 2021 were millennials between the ages of 25-40

Top-booked Airbnb Online Experiences during the MCO include family-friendly virtual scavenger hunts magic shows and cooking Experiences hosted overseas

As Malaysia looks to reopen domestic travel in the coming months Airbnb continues to steadily navigate the COVID-19 pandemic with hundreds of new local Hosts joining the platform in the first six months of 2021.

Over 60% of new Airbnb Hosts in H1 2021 comprised millennials aged between 25-40. The top five states where these new Hosts were based are Selangor Kuala Lumpur Johor Sabah and Penang. Amidst the stop-start nature of Movement Control Order regulations from January to June new Airbnb Hosts collectively earned over RM680000 from welcoming guests on Airbnb*.

This data follows Airbnb’s recent global announcement of more than 100 new upgrades across the platform including making it easier to start hosting. Based on a Q1 2021 survey conducted by Airbnb a third of Malaysian Hosts polled said the money earned through Airbnb provided an additional source of revenue for the household and helped them stay afloat and fight costs of living during the pandemic**.

“2021 has undoubtedly proved challenging as the pandemic continues to impact Malaysian livelihoods businesses and the broader economy. Hosting has offered many an additional source of income during a time of financial strain providing economic empowerment for these new hosts.” Amanpreet Bajaj Airbnb’s General Manager for Southeast Asia India Hong Kong and Taiwan

“As the conversation turns towards the return of travel it is crucial that guest and Host safety remains Airbnb’s top priority. Last year we implemented the 5-step Enhanced Clean process a set of cleaning and sanitisation standards that were developed in partnership with experts and endorsed by the Malaysian Medical Association (MMA) to ensure peace of mind for our community. We remain fully committed to supporting Malaysia’s tourism recovery efforts and we continue working hard to find new ways to drive clean and safe travel” he added.

Throughout the Movement Control Order (MCO) this year Airbnb data showed many Malaysians exploring new virtual hobbies and passions with Airbnb Online Experiences***. From family-friendly activities to picking up new skills here are the most popular Online Experiences booked by Malaysian guests in June 2021:

Amidst the unprecedented needs brought about by the pandemic Airbnb continues to work to support and strengthen the communities its Hosts call home. In June three Malaysian entities – Teach for Malaysia St Nicholas’ Home Penang and Liberty to Learn Berhad – were selected to be among the first 150 grant recipients of the inaugural Airbnb Community Fund as part of Airbnb’s pledge to distribute USD$100 million over 10 years to organizations that are strengthening communities around the world.

*Based on Airbnb internal data measuring new Malaysian Hosts’ income over the period of January to June 2021.

** Survey from Feb 1 2021 to Mar 3 2021 for Homes Hosts who hosted a trip during 2020.

***Based on Airbnb internal data measuring searches by guest location in June 2021.
Name_2: 5 Ultra-luxe Ski Homes You Can Rent Right Now for the Holidays on Airbnb
Text_2:
The nights are getting colder the leaves are starting to change the birds are packing up their bags for their big trip south. This can only mean one thing: Ski season is almost here.

To help skiers riders and snow bunnies alike get ready for the season Snow Season Central a ski information website compiled a list of the world's most over-the-top and luxurious mountainside Airbnbs. To come to its final list the group explained it "scanned Airbnb maps of many of the world's most luxurious ski resorts and found the following properties available for 10 days between Dec. 23 2021 and Jan. 2 2022."

Courtesy of Airbnb

The only caveat to the list is the fact that these aren't exactly ski bum friendly with the cheapest option clocking in at just over $23000 for the 10 days. But if you've got a little cash to spare or just want to see how the other half lives keep scrolling to see five of their Airbnb picks.

Horstman Lane: Whistler Canada

Courtesy of Airbnb

Located at one of North America's most beloved ski destinations Horstman Lane is a five-bedroom five-and-a-half-bath skier dream. The home can sleep up to 10 guests and comes with ski-in ski-out access. The home also comes with plenty of entertainment space including a home theater a gas fireplace pool table wet bar state-of-the-art sound system BBQ and outdoor hot hub. Book the home on Airbnb.

Price: $94100 for 10 nights over Christmas / New Year

Chalet White Pearl: Zermatt Switzerland

Courtesy of Airbnb

Drink in the incredible views of the Matterhorn right outside your window at this stunning property in Zermatt. The five-bedroom home is also large enough to comfortably sleep 10 people and also comes with ski-in ski-out access. Its location right near town also means easy access to the apres-ski scene though you may never want to leave the house as it comes with a plunge pool cinema room pool table bar swimming pool steam room sauna as well as a dining area that can seat 14 people. Book the home on Airbnb.

Price: $877849 for 10 nights over Christmas / New Year

Kira Kira Penthouse: Niseko Japan

Courtesy of Airbnb

Craving a ski getaway with a more intimate group? Book this penthouse located in the heart of Niseko Japan. The three-bedroom home may be smaller than its other mountainside counterparts but it more than makes up for that with style. The penthouse also comes with the requisite outdoor hot tub only this one is overlooking Mt. Yotei one of Japan's largest active volcanoes giving it all the cache it needs. Book the home on Airbnb.

Price : $23880 for 10 nights over Christmas / New Year

Chalet William: Courchevel France

Courtesy of Airbnb

Courchevel is the spot to see and be seen by your fellow rich and famous skiing friends. If you also need a spot to house them all in style look no further than Chalet William. The six-bedroom six-bath property comes with an oversized wood fireplace exercise room spa home theater massage room indoor pool and even a heated driveway just so you never have to shovel snow. But with a price tag like this one you've more than earned the right to not pick up a shovel. Book the home on Airbnb.

Price: $251747 for 10 nights over Christmas / New Year

Arabba Chalet: Dolomites Italy

Constructed out of timber and stone this chalet in the Dolomites is the very definition of mountainside luxury. The eight-bedroom A-frame comes with its own indoor pool hot tub and even comes with some meals included (including afternoon tea for when you need a little pick-me-up mid-run). Book the home on Airbnb.

Price : $66238 for 10 nights over Christmas / New Year

Want even more luxury? Check out the complete list of homes on Snow Season Central here.
Name_3: 15 Best Airbnbs in Mississippi USA (2024 Edition)
Text_3:
If you are a lover of bluegrass music Southern cuisine and Civil War history Mississippi will be right up your alley. A visit to the Magnolia State is sure to satisfy your culinary palate too. Since it is known as the Catfish Capital of the World it should serve as no surprise that it has some of the best fishing and savory seafood restaurants.

No matter your reason for visiting this southern state you’ll want to make sure you have excellent accommodation. Instead of spending hours researching rentals take a look at our list of the best Airbnbs in Mississippi. Superhosts host all of the rentals listed below and a few even boast Airbnb Plus status. For those unfamiliar with Airbnb superhosts are rental owners with a superior track record of hospitality while Airbnb Plus is an elite program that highlights outstanding homes that have been in-person verified.

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Jimmy and Jill’s Converted Silo If you are looking for a truly unique vacation rental in Mississippi consider staying in this stunning converted silo in Corinth. This Airbnb has been exceptionally renovated with comfortable furnishings so that guests can have a peaceful country stay. Outside two rocking chairs on the front porch make for the perfect spot to enjoy a glass of wine. There is also a barbecue outside where guests can grill. The home’s interior has been decorated in a contemporary country style creating a quiet and relaxing space. The full kitchen boasts stainless-steel appliances granite countertops and all the cooking essentials. In the living room there are three comfortable chairs and a sofa in front of a fireplace and flatscreen TV. If you are worried that you haven’t packed enough clothes don’t fret. There is also a separate laundry room downstairs with a washer and dryer. The master bedroom is located downstairs and features a queen-size bed surrounded by repurposed wooden décor and light blue walls. The second bedroom is a loft and has two twin beds a large dressing room and a small desk with a mirror ideal for getting ready in the morning. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Pet-Friendly House in Ocean Springs This gorgeous pet-friendly rental house in Mississippi is ideal for families or groups looking for a weekend getaway to the beach. This three-bedroom Airbnb is less than a 10-minute drive to Ocean Springs Beach and is located in the heart of the town. Many parks and boutique shops are within walking distance of the rental. The house has been beautifully styled with custom-made furniture and vibrant beach-themed artwork. In the full kitchen there is a massive island with granite countertops that allows for plenty of cooking space. There is also a TV stainless-steel appliances and a breakfast bar. In the living room guests can relax on the couch and stream their favorite movies and shows on the Smart TV. The master bedroom has a king-size bed a massive walk-in closet with custom organizers and an en suite bathroom featuring a walk-in shower and soaking tub. The other two bedrooms have queen-size beds. Outside there is a spacious backyard with a playset the kids will love as well as a patio dining set where families can enjoy meals together. Superhosts Hanna and Matthew also provide guests with bikes a kids’ bike trailer and a stroller for guests to use at their leisure. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Luxurious Country Cabin A country escape can be just the cure for those stressed out by their everyday routines and city life. This stunning cabin near Bruce offers visitors a chance to unwind in a luxurious bungalow on a private six-acre lake. For those looking to partake in outdoor activities there are two miles of well-tended hiking trails on the property. The lake is also perfect for fishing swimming canoeing and more. After a day of adventuring guests can gather around the firepit and relax in the Adirondack chairs while roasting s’mores. Alternatively guests can retreat to the screened-in porch and relax on the swinging sofa bed if it’s too buggy out. This recently renovated cabin features high ceilings with gorgeous wood beams. The master bedroom and the second bedroom both have a queen-size bed and an en suite bathroom. The third bedroom has two single beds and a pullout couch. This rental can sleep nine guests using the sofa bed in the living room. This cabin rental in Mississippi has many fantastic amenities like a fully stocked kitchen a washer and dryer board games an indoor fireplace and an EV charging station for electric vehicles. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Woodland Lake Retreat If you are looking for a vacation home for rent in Mississippi that offers unparalleled lake access and welcomes your furry friends this rental is for you. There is no shortage of lake fun here as guests will have access to the home’s private dock. Fishing enthusiasts can purchase bait at the nearby bait shop only six minutes away and spend the day catching bass and catfish. After a day on the water relax on one of the three decks and enjoy the sunset with a glass of wine or barbecue some fresh fish on the grill out back. The interior of this three-bedroom home is decorated in contemporary furnishings offering a relaxing and stylish space. In the master bedroom there is a queen-size bed a fan and a large wardrobe. The second bedroom is located in the basement and features a queen-size bed a couch and a TV. The third bedroom is also downstairs and has two sets of bunk beds making this rental suitable for up to eight guests. The upstairs has an open-concept floor plan that includes a full kitchen a dining room with a table for up to six and a living room with two couches and a TV. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Ramsey Springs Round House This is the perfect Airbnb for anyone looking to rent a cabin in Mississippi and take the family on a peaceful nature retreat. The home is situated on secluded lakefront acreage surrounded by forest. Spend your days paddling the lake in the two-person paddle boat fishing or hiking with the family. When you are ready to wind down sit out on the back porch in the soft glow of Tiki torches with a glass of wine and indulge in some stargazing. The interior of the home features an open-concept floor plan and gorgeous high wood ceilings. Guests can relax on the leather couch and watch sports on the TV or break out a board game for a family game night. In the full kitchen there is a Keurig coffee maker a breakfast bar and all the essentials for preparing a meal. The master bedroom is quite spacious and features a king-size bed a walkout to the porch and plenty of storage space. In the second bedroom there is a set of bunk beds and an en suite bathroom. The other bathroom boasts a luxurious large jetted soaking tub and a walk-in shower. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Beach House in Gulfport Are you planning a beach vacation with the girls or a couples getaway? Look no further than this unique treehouse-style Airbnb in Gulfport Mississippi. The home is located directly on the water in Long Beach and offers guests unbeatable sunset views from its balconies. Many bars and restaurants are within walking distance of this rental and Island View Casino Resort is just a short drive away. This Airbnb in Mississippi has two bedrooms one with a king-size bed and the other with a double bed. In the living room there is a comfortable white leather sectional couch an electric fireplace and a Smart TV with a soundbar where guests can access their favorite streaming services. The full kitchen comes well stocked with all the essentials including complimentary snacks a bottle of wine and a Keurig coffee maker. There are two bathrooms one downstairs with a shower and one upstairs with a large bathtub and separate shower. Although this house is raised don’t let the stairs deter you. There is an elevator for those with mobility impairments. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Historical House in New Albany This Airbnb in Mississippi is the perfect blend of Southern charm and modern amenities. The home was built in 1867 and sits on a 150-acre property with walking trails a private lake with fishing access a greenhouse and more. There is also a pool where guests can cool down on those hot Mississippi days. The interior of the house has vintage furnishings that give a historic and rustic feel to the space. In the bathroom guests can take a relaxing soak in the stunning claw-foot bathtub. The master bedroom has an exposed brick fireplace a luggage rack and a queen-size bed. In the second bedroom there is also a queen-size bed making this rental suitable for four people. The full kitchen is very modern and is well equipped with everything needed to prepare a meal. Guests can enjoy their meals at the breakfast bar or at the extendable dining table. This Mississippi Airbnb is only a short drive to historic downtown New Albany. Trace State Park is a 25-minute drive and Holy Springs National Forest is a 55-minute drive away from this rental. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Hedge Farm Cottage If you are looking to rent a house in Mississippi consider staying at superhost Anna’s charming historic cottage near Byhalia. This Mississippi Airbnb is situated on 175 acres with horse pastures and gardens where guests can roam. The farm is located on the Mississippi–Tennessee border just 25 minutes from Memphis. Elvis fans can take a day trip to Graceland as the famed mansion is only a 45-minute drive away. For those looking to take part in more outdoorsy activities Holy Springs State Park where there are some fantastic hiking trails and fishing holes is only a 10-minute drive away. This one-bedroom pet-friendly house is ideal for couples or those traveling with their furry friends. The bedroom is located upstairs and features a TV a comfortable queen-size bed and a set of drawers. In the living room guests will find an assortment of board games brick floors a woodburning fireplace and a small desk. The full kitchen is complete with granite countertops and stainless-steel appliances. After a day of touring the grounds guests can return and rinse off in the large walk-in shower. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Beachside Condo in Biloxi Spend a day at the beach or the pool at this modern Airbnb in Biloxi Mississippi. This studio apartment is one of the best Mississippi Airbnbs for two reasons: The location is unmatched and the space is stunning. The interior of the home is spacious and features many modern amenities creating an upscale and comfortable stay. After a day at the beach guests can snuggle under 600 thread count sheets in the bedroom and stream their favorite shows and movies on the Smart TV. The bedroom also has plenty of storage space for unpacking clothes and a small desk perfect for those looking to get some work done while on holiday. Guests can wake up and enjoy a hot cup of coffee from the full kitchen’s French press or rinse off in the bathroom’s walk-in rain shower. The Airbnb Plus comes with access to a shared pool that is open daily and superhost Gena even supplies soft cotton Turkish towels. If you’re more of a beach person Biloxi Beach is a short five-minute walk away. Many restaurants and bars are also within walking distance. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Rustic Cabin Near Roosevelt National Park Get back to nature and unwind in the country at this rustic two-bedroom cabin for rent in Mississippi. This cozy house is ideal for families or couples. It is situated on 19 acres of beautiful wooded forest offering visitors plenty of hiking trails to discover. The interior consists of wood walls ceilings and floors giving it an authentic country feel. In the living room guests can lounge on the comfortable reclining couch and watch TV or read a book. The full kitchen features stunning wood cabinets and has plenty of counter space for cooking. In the bathroom there is a large walk-in shower that is handicap-friendly. There is also a wheelchair ramp outside leading to the front door making this rental very accessible. The master bedroom boasts a comfortable queen-size bed and a spacious walk-in closet with tons of organization nooks and hangers for unpacking. The second bedroom has two twin beds. A rollout bed can be requested making this rental suitable for up to five people. There is a large deck outside with a grill and a dining table. Guests can also spend the afternoon with a book on the rocking chairs or rinse off in the private outdoor shower. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Adults-Only Retreat Near Gloster This adults-only pet-friendly Airbnb in Mississippi is the ideal rental for couples or friend groups looking to escape to the outdoors and disconnect from technology. The house is surrounded by Homochitto National Forest offering guests access to hiking trails sandy riverbanks and an abundance of wildlife. There are also plenty of mountain biking trails nearby for those looking to bring their bikes. Guests will truly have a chance to reconnect with nature here as the home doesn’t offer Wi-Fi or TV. This two-bedroom house has a classic cabin feel to it with a wooden interior and cozy furnishings. There is a loft bedroom accessible by a ladder that features a queen-size bed and a fan. The second bedroom has a double bed. In the living room there is a small library where guests can cozy up next to the woodburning fireplace and relax with a good book. The full kitchen is well stocked with all the essentials including a coffee maker. Perhaps the most unique part of this rental is the outdoor bathtub. Guests can enjoy a glass of wine or hot chocolate while soaking and listening to the sounds of the surrounding nature. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Tiny House Farm Stay Ever wanted to stay in a tiny house? Then consider this Mississippi Airbnb at Fulmer’s Farmstead near New Augusta. This 240-square-foot cabin features a beautiful wrap-around porch complete with Amish rocking chairs. Inside all of the house’s space has been maximized to create a functional and comfortable living area. There is a ladder leading to a loft with two double beds. The second bedroom features a queen-size bed a wall-mounted TV and a small collection of books. In the bathroom there is a modern walk-in shower where guests can rinse off after a day of adventuring. The kitchenette includes a minifridge a Keurig coffee maker and a microwave. Guests can enjoy their meals at the two-person breakfast bar attached to the window overlooking the farm. This Airbnb in Mississippi is nestled in a pecan orchard on a 40-acre horse-powered produce farm. Guests can tour the farm and watch superhost John’s Percheron draft horses at work in the fields. The property also has a general store where John and his family sell their local produce along with other convenient items. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Beachside Cottage in Gulfport Another excellent house rental in Gulfport Mississippi is this one-bedroom cottage just steps away from the beach. This Airbnb is perfect for couples or families looking for a beach vacation. Inside is quite spacious and has been styled with contemporary furniture creating a comfortable space for guests to relax. In the living room there are two couches and a large flatscreen TV. An air mattress can also be set up so that four people can stay in the rental. The full kitchen has all the cooking basics and a small dining table for two. In the bedroom there is a plush king-size bed a wardrobe and a TV. In the bedroom’s en suite bathroom there is a shower and a relaxing jetted bathtub where guests can enjoy a relaxing soak after a long day at the beach. Outside there is a backyard with a firepit and two chairs. Guests can sit out and enjoy the night air with a glass of wine and kids will have plenty of space to kick a ball around. This short-term rental in Mississippi is within walking distance of many popular restaurants bars and the beach. Island View Casino Resort and downtown Gulfport are just a short drive away. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Eden’s Downtown Retreat in Jackson This rental is perfect for couples or solo travelers looking for an Airbnb in Jackson Mississippi. This one-bedroom apartment is part of a duplex and has been beautifully decorated with warm décor and cozy furnishings. In the living room floor-to-ceiling windows offer plenty of natural light and guests can relax on the sofa while streaming their favorite shows on the Smart TV. The full kitchen is well equipped for all cooking needs and superhost Eden even supplies complimentary breakfast foods coffee tea and filtered and bottled water. The bedroom features a queen-size memory foam mattress and room-darkening shades so guests are guaranteed a good night’s rest. The room also has a dedicated workspace with a desk that can double as a vanity for getting ready. This Mississippi Airbnb is within walking distance to some of the city’s most well-known attractions such as the Mississippi Civil Rights Museum. Millsaps College and Belhaven University are also within walking distance. Don’t forget to sample some Southern cuisine at Lou’s Full Serve one of the city’s most popular restaurants which is nearby this rental. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Charming Cottage in the Mississippi Delta This cottage is one of the best Airbnb rentals in Mississippi because it is more like a resort and less like a home rental. Superhost Lars would like to invite you to stay on his 1700-acre bucolic farm located outside of Indianola. The property offers guests full access to all the on-site amenities such as a swimming pool tennis courts horseback riding walking trails and more. The cottage has an open-concept layout with two comfortable double beds. Lars can also provide a crib and babysitter recommendation for those traveling with little ones. Beside the beds there is a small library where guests can choose a book and head out to the screened-in porch to read on the patio furniture. The kitchenette is complete with a sink minifridge microwave toaster stove and coffee machine so guests can easily prepare simple meals. There is a small sitting area in the corner with two lounge chairs perfect for relaxing and watching movies on the Smart TV. Lars even provides Netflix. For Blues enthusiasts B.B. King’s grave and The B.B. King Museum & Delta Interpretive Center are only a short drive away in Indianola. View on Airbnb

There you have it the best Airbnbs in Mississippi. Whether you are planning a farm stay beach getaway or lake house retreat they are all on this list. So what are you waiting for? Pack your bags grab your partner or family and hit the road! The Magnolia State is calling.
Name_4: Dallas Mansions You Can Book as Vacation Rentals
Text_4:
A pandemic-prompted remote-work trend has folks scouring the country for spacious comfortable real estate but with house prices at approximately stratospheric the market favors the rich. There are ways though for the more fiscally limited to sample the dream sans the commitment of a second-home mortgage. A big family or a group of traveling friends can land a Wi-Fi-enabled villa with surroundings so luxe that relaxing playing writing that romance novel or even catching up on emails comes easier. The bright side to Dallas sprawl? Rural retreats state parks lakes and rambling acreage is generally just minutes from uptown estates city-center party scenes museums historical sites sports venues and world-famous restaurants. Upon surfing the surfeit of Dallas area vacation rentals these offer the best of both worlds and the most room to spread one’s wings at per-person costs that by far beat the expense of posting up at a relatively cramped bourgeois hotel.



Related: 30 Jaw-Dropping Yet Affordable Mansions for Rent Across the Country
Name_5: 10 Cool Melbourne Airbnbs [2022 Edition]
Text_5:
Sydney may grab headlines and attract millions of tourists due to its world-famous landmarks but for art culture and nightlife Melbourne is the place to go.

Australia’s cultural capital is an exciting place to visit no matter the time of year as you can always find something relating to style sport or art happening in its various communal spaces or down hidden laneways. And with it being home to a high number of cool restaurants bars and pubs there’s plenty to keep you occupied.

Stately Gold Rush architecture blends seamlessly with edgy street art and hip art galleries. Trendy coffee shops and independent bookstores mix with iconic music venues and boutique menswear stores.

There are gardens for the outdoorsy – including a number of walking routes both in the Melbourne’s Central Business District (CBD) and further afield – races and stadiums for the sports-mad and more laneway eateries than a foodie could ever hope to feast at.

Every traveller knows that the best way to experience a city is to do as the locals do so skip the hotel – although if you must stay in one Melbourne is home to some amazingly cool boutique hotels – on your next trip and book of the best Melbourne Airbnbs.

Warehouse-Style Apartment | CBD

This CBD one-bedroom apartment could not be more centrally located if it tried. Just off Little Collins Street and accessed via a laneway this open-plan warehouse-style spacious apartment oozes character with exposed beams and heaps of wooden furniture. It’s capable of catering for up to six guests with a king bed on a mezzaine floor a sofa bed and a floor mattress included. It might not be everyone’s idea of luxury then but with a tough-to-beat location and an incredibly cool living space we don’t really care. Plus you’ll have an entire rental unit all to yourself.

Book @ Airbnb

The Spaceship Penthouse | CBD

The owner of this apartment describes it as a spaceship and to be honest we can’t think of a better word ourselves. Serving up 270-degree views of Melbourne looking over the Yarra River and out to the Rialto Towers Melbourne Cricket Ground and the Docklands by way of a cockpit-style window array you’ll be hard pushed to find a better view. In summer the terrace offers a perfect place for al fresco dining and with access to the building’s gym included it’s the perfect stay for couples or solo travellers.

Book @ Airbnb

Birdcage Penthouse | CBD

This could be the best-looking studio apartment in Melbourne at least in our opinion. Decked out in black with subtle pops of colour and strategically-placed lighting this penthouse apartment at the top of the Birdcage North building scream bachelor’s paradise.

It’s huge being able to sleep up to 9 guests in 4 bedrooms and caters for kids with a separate playroom and a dedicated cinema room. Even though the best Melbourne has to offer is several floors down you’ll probably find yourself struggling to leave.

Book @ Airbnb

Architectural Retreat | Hawthorn

If you don’t fancy staying so central this Hawthorn home could be right up your alley. An architectural paradise if ever there was one the home is dominated by walls of glass and steel that allow plenty of natural light to flood in. It provides plenty of space for you and up to seven additional guests and if you head outside you’ll not only be treated to a swimming pool but also a garden teeming with all manner of edibles whether it be veggies herbs or fruits.

Book @ Airbnb

Toorak Luxury | Toorak

A far cry from the Toorak apartment we recently saw listed for sale this Toorak home is opulence defined. Everything you could ever want or need from a home is included in the nightly fee (apart from maybe a butler) with grandeur around every corner and in every room. Premium appliances and every gadget you could dream of (there’s Sonos throughout) coupled with comfortable beds and a generous outdoors dining area. Also it’s within walking distance to the train station making it incredibly easy for you to get to the city. If you’re in Melbourne for some considerable time this is where you’ll want to stay.

Book @ Airbnb

New York Style Apartment | Southbank

Similar to the opening modern apartment with its lofty warehouse vibes this Southbank pad is oh so cool and one of the best vacation rentals around. Perfectly located for the abundance of entertainment on offer in Melbourne this apartment has ample room for four people. Modern furnishings are paired with stripped-back brickwork and the upstairs area accessed via a stunning staircase leads you to comfortable bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms. This two-bedroom apartment also provides you with access to the gym heated pool and sauna included for a spot of pampering.

Book @ Airbnb

Converted Church | Brunswick

This Fitzroy home is pretty special as not many other Melbourne Airbnbs can say they’re in converted churches. Impeccably finished inside with all the modern amenities you could want all while retaining its cathedral ceilings exposed brickwork and wooden beams. The home is split over three floors so there is plenty to explore and a private outdoors area will provide space to continue an evening spent in the city drinking with friends.

Book @ Airbnb

Melbourne Castle | Kew

If it’s genuine uniqueness you’re after from your Melbourne Airbnb look no further than this seven-storey home situtated inside what used to be Kew Asylum. No psychiatric patients roam the halls any longer but instead you’ll find space for 12 guests and views over Melbourne’s leafy suburbs and across to the CBD. Your tenure includes access to tennis courts swimming pool and bowling green but with so many floors to explore inside you may end up getting lost. It’s hard to describe this home in words you’ll just have to book it and see for yourself.

Book @ Airbnb

Beachside Oasis | St Kilda

If you want to stay near Melbourne’s best-known beach then we reckon you’ll be more than comfortable staying in this three-bed home. Architecturally designed with each room flowing into the next. A separate private studio can be used to store your annoying kids. Exposed copper pipework provides an interesting and refreshing change to usual house décor but teamed with concrete it’s the perfect touch. We imagine you’ll be spending most of your time at either of the two outdoor BBQ terraces though as they offer scintillating views across Melbourne.

Book @ Airbnb

Melbourne Penthouse/Parkville

If you’re looking to stay in an exceptionally luxurious place overlooking Melbourne’s Parkville area then make sure to book this snappy apartment. This expansive apartment is laid over the top two floors of the Arcadia Building and can hold up to four guests. With impressive views and a private balcony this apartment is covered with chic artwork and sculptures. Designed by Fender Katsalidis Architects the curved building has a contemporary look balanced with the luxe aesthetic with an open-concept living room with all the finishing touches.

Book @ Airbnb

Como Park House/South Yarra

Get ready because this luxury Como house ticks just about every box when it comes to the perfect Melbourne Airbnb. This beautifully designed house is sleek modern has an infinity plunge pool and a built-in trampoline – the ideal place to let loose. However the vibrant and playful nature of the house is also balanced with its refined aesthetic of tree-shaded decks and spacious courtyard that can host up to six people a great place to entertain. Guests will also be able to make the most of the wine cooler fireplace and sound system on the colder winter evenings.

This rental has three bedrooms with queen beds two ensuite bathrooms a master bedroom and one that shares a bathroom with the fourth bedroom which has two beds.

Book @ Airbnb

Design House/St Kilda

This designer house has a highly contemporary sleek interior paired period details including an Edwardian terrace – made from handmade tiles antique marble fireplaces mid-century furniture and an exclusive art collection. If you’re looking to stay somewhere that has great charm then this house is for you as it comes to an incredibly homey feel with some eccentric finishing touches. This house also includes a full kitchen three bedrooms laundry and backyard making it incredibly convenient.

Book @ Airbnb

Read Next

The Best Suit Shops In Melbourne

Name_1: Joseph Christian Kittelson Obituary - The Arizona Republic
Text_1:
Joseph Christian Kittelson

Chandler – Joseph Christian Kittelson 76 of Chandler AZ passed away on Thursday September 9 2021 at the Mayo Clinic Hospital surrounded by his loving family. Joe was born on January 31 1945 in Portland OR to parents Ione and Clarence Kittelson. He grew up on a farm in Goodhue MN with his 13 siblings and graduated from Goodhue High School in 1963. Joe attended and graduated from St. John's University and earned a Bachelor's Degree in Finance in 1967. He married the love of his life Norma Gonzalez on June 28 1986. Joe took pride in his career and excelled at his jobs at Contract Beverages Pepsi-Cola Coca-Cola MEI and Hexcel. Joe with his wife Norma then started their insurance agencies at Allstate Insurance. His competitiveness and work ethic drove him to be a top performer and the largest Allstate agent in the state. He semi-retired from his Allstate Insurance business ten years ago. Joe had many hobbies his favorite included traveling the world with his wife bowling on his Thursday night men's league golfing and supporting his children's life accomplishments.

He is survived by his wife Norma children Christine (Jon) Houglum of MN James (Shwezin) Imbrogno Rachel Guynn Nicole (Joe) Kittelson Elizabeth (Ronald) Kittelson all of AZ. Grandchildren Jesus Jr (Ashley) Trevino Erin Houglum James Trevino Gabriella Trevino and Matthew Houglum. Siblings; Diana Kittelson Merlin (Diane) Kittelson Sandra (Michael) Dols Linda Kittelson Tom (Molly) Kittelson Jim Kittelson Kelvin (Bev) Kittelson David Kittelson Teresa (John) Sutton Roger Kittelson and Ruth Ann (Rich) Allen. Siblings-in-law; Susan Giordano Sandra Gonzalez Angelo Gonzalez and M. Eliza Gonzalez.

Preceding him in his passing are his parents Clarence and Ione brother Rodney sister Roberta Andrist son-in-law LaMontae Guynn father-in-law Angel Gonzalez and mother-in-law Irene Sanders.

Joe's memorial service will be held on September 18 2021 at The Church of the Epiphany at 2222 S. Price Rd Tempe AZ 85282. The viewing will be from 9am – 11am with the service following at 11am. There will be a reception to follow.
